intro: Silene pestalozzae, commonly known as the Pestalozza's campion, is a flowering plant species native to the mountainous regions of central Europe. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-purple flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Silene pestalozzae is a perennial herb with slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ecologically important species in its native environment.
